item.title: 据称铂金公司考虑以 60 亿欧元出售西班牙 Urbaser 公司
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，投资公司 Platinum Equity 正在考虑出售 Urbaser SA 的可能性，包括债务在内，该西班牙废物管理公司的估值可能达到 60 亿欧元（64 亿美元）或更高。【原文：Investment firm Platinum Equity is considering a potential sale of Urbaser SA in a deal that could value the Spanish waste-management company at €6 billion ($6.4 billion) or more including debt, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 埃斯科姆公司（Eskom）就 210 亿美元的电网建设考虑私营和外国方案
item.description: 南非国有电力公司 Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd. 表示，随着更多可再生能源发电的投产，该公司正与政府部门就私营和外资为其输电网络扩建提供 3900 亿兰特（约合 210 亿美元）资金的方案进行谈判。【原文：South Africa’s state-owned power utility Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd. said it’s in talks with government ministries over private and foreign options to fund a 390 billion-rand ($21 billion) expansion of its transmission network as more renewable generation comes online.】

item.title: 电池制造商 Varta 因重组困境加深而暴跌
item.description: 德国电池制造商瓦尔塔公司（Varta AG）股价暴跌，此前该公司表示，各业务领域的进一步恶化意味着去年与银行达成的重组计划不再合适。【原文：Shares in German battery maker Varta AG plunged after the company said a further deterioration in various business areas means a restructuring plan agreed with banks last year is no longer appropriate.】

item.title: 铜价持续上涨，飙升至 2022 年 6 月以来最高点
item.description: 铜价继续上扬，创下 22 个月以来的最高水平，因为投资者押注矿山供应减少将难以跟上全球需求的恢复。【原文：Copper continued its upwards charge, hitting the highest level in 22 months, as investors bet that curtailed mine supply will struggle to keep up with resurgent global demand.】

item.title: 希腊央行行长敦促欧洲央行允许贷款人支付股息
item.description: 希腊银行行长亚尼斯-斯托纳拉斯（Yannis Stournaras）敦促欧洲中央银行允许希腊的贷款人在监管机构于 6 月审议此事时派发股息。【原文：Bank of Greece Governor Yannis Stournaras urged the European Central Bank to allow dividend payouts by his country’s lenders when supervisors consider the matter in June.】

item.title: 本地需求疲软，中国钢铁出口创 2016 年以来新高
item.description: 中国的钢铁出口创下了 2016 年以来最强劲的一个月，这一激增可能会为抱怨中国政府的产业政策提供更多素材。【原文：China’s steel exports posted the strongest month since 2016, in a surge that will likely offer more fodder for complaints about Beijing’s industrial policies.】

item.title: 国际能源署警告俄罗斯炼油厂遭袭可能扰乱柴油市场
item.description: 国际能源机构表示，乌克兰无人机对俄罗斯炼油厂的一系列袭击有可能扰乱全球石油产品市场。【原文：The flurry of Ukrainian drone attacks on Russia’s oil refineries risks disrupting global markets for petroleum products, the International Energy Agency said.】

item.title: 欧洲央行调查显示 2025 年通胀率将放缓至 2% 目标值
item.description: 欧洲中央银行对专业预测人士进行的季度民意调查显示，该行明年将实现通胀目标。【原文：The European Central Bank will meet its inflation target next year, according to its quarterly poll of professional forecasters.】

item.title: 中国承诺加强股市监管以控制风险
item.description: 中国内阁在周五发布的新指导原则中誓言收紧股票上市标准，并敦促公司改善公司治理，这是支持中国股票市场的最新努力。【原文：China’s cabinet vowed to tighten stock listing criteria and urged companies to improve corporate governance in new guidelines released Friday, the latest effort to support the nation’s equity market.】

item.title: 穆勒称欧洲央行可能在 6 月因通胀放缓而降息
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员马迪斯-穆勒（Madis Muller）表示，随着欧元区通胀率向 2% 的目标放缓，欧洲中央银行可能会在 6 月份降低利率。【原文：The European Central Bank may lower interest rates in June as euro-area inflation slows toward the 2% target, according to Governing Council member Madis Muller.】

item.title: LVMH、欧莱雅面临中国之痛：欧洲、中东和非洲地区财报周前瞻
item.description: 下周，奢侈品巨头路威酩轩集团（LVMH SE）、北欧电信业巨头爱立信公司（Ericsson AB）和诺基亚公司（Nokia Oyj）将迎来第一季度财报季。【原文：Welcome back to the EMEA Earnings Week Ahead fixture, with luxury giant LVMH SE and Nordic telecommunication archrivals Ericsson AB and Nokia Oyj set to usher in the first-quarter reporting season next week.】

item.title: 中国将建设更多煤矿以满足激增的电力需求
item.description: 据国家发展和改革委员会称，中国将建设更多煤矿，以增加国内供应并抑制价格上涨。【原文：China will build more coal mines in its push for higher domestic supply and to tame price increases, according to the National Development and Reform Commission.】

item.title: 欧洲央行与美联储分歧加剧，欧元跌至五个月低点
item.description: 欧元跌至今年以来的最低水平，因为欧洲中央银行似乎将先于美联储降息。【原文：The euro fell to its lowest level this year as the European Central Bank looks set to cut interest rates before the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 英国央行行长格林称美国消费者 "无情 "超越英国和欧元区
item.description: 英格兰银行决策者梅根-格林（Megan Greene）表示，美国的经济表现优于英国和欧元区，因为美国人更愿意花掉他们的储蓄。【原文：Bank of England policymaker Megan Greene said the US is outperforming the UK and the Eurozone as Americans are more willing to spend their savings.】

item.title: 中国出口下降打击经济反弹希望
item.description: 中国 3 月份出口下降，打击了全球需求将继续帮助推动世界第二大经济体增长的希望。【原文：China’s exports fell in March, dealing a blow to hopes that global demand would continue to help drive growth in the world’s second-largest economy.】

item.title: 哈萨克斯坦结束最长宽松周期，关注价格压力
item.description: 哈萨克斯坦停止了近十年来持续时间最长的一系列降息措施，在央行估量国内和邻国俄罗斯的物价压力之际，维持了借贷成本。【原文：Kazakhstan halted its longest series of interest-rate cuts in nearly a decade, holding the cost of borrowing as the central bank gauges price pressures at home and in neighboring Russia.】

item.title: 美国限制航班频率，中国航空公司业绩下滑
item.description: 周五，中国最大的航空公司股价暴跌，因为投资者对美国航空公司试图阻止世界上最大的两个经济体之间增加航班频率的消息作出了反应。【原文：Shares of China’s biggest airlines slumped on Friday as investors reacted to news that US carriers are trying to block any increase in flight frequencies between the world’s two biggest economies.】

item.title: 1987 年式崩溃风险促使鲁弗尔创纪录地押注现金
item.description: 随着美国流动性的萎缩，市场发生剧烈逆转的可能性增大，Ruffer LLP 将其有史以来最大的赌注押在了现金上。【原文：Ruffer LLP is making its biggest-ever bet on cash as shrinking US liquidity boosts the possibility of a violent market reversal.】

item.title: 英国称汽车贷款公司应为调查带来的财务影响做好准备
item.description: 英国金融行为监管局（Financial Conduct Authority）警告汽车金融公司开始为其汽车金融产品审查可能产生的额外成本做好准备，因为近几个月来，贷款机构在是否立即对盈利造成打击的问题上意见不一。【原文：The Financial Conduct Authority warned motor finance firms to begin preparing for additional costs that may arise from its review of car finance products after lenders in recent months diverged on whether to take an immediate hit to earnings.】

item.title: StanChart 任命中国区首席执行官张杰瑞为金融投资部联席主管
item.description: 渣打银行中国区首席执行官张杰瑞将担任金融机构业务全球联席主管的新职务，这是渣打银行新成立的企业与投资银行内部更广泛改组的一部分。【原文：Standard Chartered Plc’s China Chief Executive Officer Jerry Zhang will take on a new role as global co-head of financial institutions coverage, as part of a broader reshuffle within the bank’s new corporate and investment bank.】

item.title: 日本央行押注，日本五年期收益率升至 2011 年以来最高点
item.description: 日本五年期国债收益率攀升至 2011 年以来的最高点，原因是越来越多的人猜测日本央行将提高利率以遏制日元疲软。【原文：Japan’s five-year bond yield climbed to the highest since 2011 on growing speculation the nation’s central bank will raise interest rates to stem weakness in the yen.】

item.title: 据说 MUFG 正在讨论以 17 亿美元收购 HDFC 部门的股份
item.description: 据知情人士透露，三菱日联金融集团公司（Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group Inc.【原文：Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group Inc. is in talks to acquire a roughly $1.7 billion stake in HDFC Bank Ltd.’s consumer lending unit to tap booming demand for personal finance loans in India, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 斯托纳拉斯：欧洲央行是时候与美联储背道而驰了
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员亚尼斯-斯托纳拉斯（Yannis Stournaras）认为，欧洲中央银行不应害怕改变其 "过于谨慎 "的利率立场，而不是像美联储那样。【原文：The European Central Bank shouldn’t be afraid to shift its “overly prudent” stance on interest rates away from that of the Federal Reserve, according to Governing Council member Yannis Stournaras.】

item.title: 中国银行称开发商贷款出现问题不会怪罪员工
item.description: 为了响应政府的号召，支持陷入困境的房地产市场，中国多家国有银行正在做出最大努力，鼓励信贷人员为开发商审批贷款。【原文：A number of Chinese state banks are making their strongest effort yet to encourage credit officers to approve loans for developers, in a bid to heed the government’s call to prop up the embattled real estate market.】

item.title: 英国经济 2 月份连续第二个月增长
item.description: 2016 年 5 月 13 日星期五，一名佩戴英国国旗徽章的员工在英国伦敦的 Brompton 自行车有限公司工厂内为一辆 Brompton 折叠自行车焊接拉伸管。Brompton 由剑桥大学毕业的工程师安德鲁-里奇（Andrew Ritchie）于 1975 年创造。摄影师：西蒙-道森【原文：An employee wearing British Union flag badge welds a tension tube for a Brompton folding bicycle inside the Brompton Bicycle Ltd. factory in London, U.K., on Friday, May 13, 2016. The Brompton was created in 1975 by Andrew Ritchie, a Cambridge-trained engineer. Photographer: Simon Dawson】

item.title: 欧洲央行卡扎克斯称有望在 6 月降息
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员马丁斯-卡扎克（Martins Kazaks）表示，欧洲中央银行有望在 6 月份开始降低借贷成本。【原文：The European Central Bank is on track to start lowering borrowing costs in June, according to Governing Council member Martins Kazaks.】

item.description: 寄希望于延续去年全球债券涨势的投资者受到了残酷的现实检验。【原文：Investors wagering on an extension of last year’s global bond gains have been served a harsh reality check.】
